column4: does anyone know a way to extract an .exe driver without installing it?
archive manager returns "and error occurred while loading the archive", I'm gonna go with the cabextract idea
if all else fails you can try to use wine to extract it (that's usually my last resort)
dont have wine, never even heard of it, gonna try cabextract. brb >.<
that kinda failed actually...do i need to extract it first?
do, you have to execute this --> sudo aptitude install cabextract
what exactly did that acheive? (besides displaying a bunch of errors)
sudo aptitude install cabextract shoudl install cabextract. If that won work because it cant find it, then type sudo aptitude update
what did the command << sudo aptitude update >> give you? please pastebin that.
can't paste...irc is on a separate computer, as ubuntu comp has no internt -.-
explains why it wont install that package. Can you get ubuntu pc with internet? Do you know how the repo's work?
dunno what repo is, cant get internet on ubuntu pc, no hardline available -.-
